title: London, BL, Add. 17236
Digital Catalogue of Syriac Manuscripts in the British Library
second part of an 'Εκλογάδιον, ܟܠܘܓܘܕܝܘܢ, or selection from the Menaea, comprising the months of Shĕbāt — Ab (February—August).
Shĕbāt, February.
the 1st, the προέορτιον, profestum, or Vigil, of the Presentation.
the 2nd, the Presentation of our Lord in the Temple.
the 17th, the Commemoration of the martyr Theodore.
the 24th, the Invention of the Head of S. John the Baptist.
Adār, March.
the 9th, the Commemoration of the forty Martyrs.
the 24th, the Vigil of the Annunciation.
the 25th, the Annunciation of the blessed Virgin.
Nīsān, April.
the 23d, the Commemoration of the martyr George.
the 25th, the Commemoration of S. Mark the Evangelist.
Iyār, May.
the 8th, the Commemoration of S. John the Evangelist and of Arsenius.
the 15th, the Commemoration of the blessed Virgin.
the 24th, the Commemoration of Simeon Stylites.
Hazīrān, June.
the 8th, the Translation of the body of the martyr Theodore.
the 11th, the Commemoration of the Apostles, S. Bartholomew and S. Barnabas.
the 14th, the Commemoration of the prophet Elisha.
the 24th, the Nativity of S. John the Baptist.
the 29th, the Commemoration of S. Peter and S. Paul.
Tāmūz, July.
the 1st, the Commemoration of the martyrs Cosmas and Damian.
the 2d, the Festival of the Garment of the blessed Virgin.
the 8th, the Commemoration of the martyr Procopius.
the 17th, the Commemoration of the martyr Marina.
the 20th, the Ascension of Elijah the prophet.
the 25th, the Decease of Anna, the mother of the Virgin Mary.
the 27th, the Commemoration of the martyr Panteleemon.
Ab, August.
the 1st, the Commemoration of the Maccabees, Shamūnī, her seven sons, and their tutor Eleazar.
the 5th, the Vigil of the Transfiguration of our Lord.
the 6th, the Feast of the Transfiguration.
the 7th, the Commemoration of the martyr Domitius.
the 9th, the Commemoration of S. Matthias the Apostle.
the 14th, the Vigil of the Decease of the blessed Virgin.
the 15th, the Commemoration of the Decease of the blessed Virgin.
the 29th, the Commemoration of the Decollation of S. John the Baptist.
the 31st, the Commemoration of the Girdle of the blessed Virgin.

colophons: Colophon The colophon on fol. 242 a and the following note state that this book was written, A.Gr. 1595 , A.D. 1284 , in the convent of S. Mary Deipara on the river (كفتون) ܟܦܬܘܢ , near Tripolis , under the rule of the first abbat of the convent, Sim 'ān ibn Jākir (?) , by one Gerasimus ( Γεράσιμος , جراسمه ) ibn Sim 'ān , from the village of Ar-Rummāna ( الرُّمَّانَة ) in the district of Az-Zabadānī ( الزبداني ) , near Damascus . ܐܬܟܬܒ ܘܐܫܬܡܠܝ ܟܬܒܐ ܗܢܐ: ܕܐܝܬ܏ܘ: ܟܠܘܓܘܕܝܘܢ ܦܠܓܐ ܐܚܪܝܐ ܡܢ ܡܓܒܝܘܬܐ ܕܥ̈ܐܕܐ ܕܫܢܬܐ ܒܥܘܕܪܢ ܡܪܝܐ܀ ܫܩܠ ܕܝܢ ܣܟܐ ܘܫܘܡܠܝܐ܀ ܝܘܡ ܏ܗ܀ ܏ܒܫ܀ ܒܥܣܪ̈ܝܢ ܡܢ ܢܝܣܢ ܝܪܚܐ܀ ܫܢܬ ܐܠܦ: ܘܬ܏ܩ܀ ܘܨ܏ܗ܀ ܝܘ̈ܢܝܐ ܒܕܝܪܐ ܕܩܕܝܫܬܐ ܡܪܬܢ ܝܠܕܬ ܐܠܗܐ܀ ܥܠ ܢܗܪܐ ܕܟܦܬܘܢ܀ ܥܠ ܐܝ̈ܕܝ ܚ̇ܛܝܐ ܘܡܣܟܢܐ: ܘܒܨܝܪ ܒܟܗ̈ܢܐ ܘܕܝܪ̈ܝܐ ܓܪܐܣܡܗ. ܡܢܝܚ ܢܦܫܗ ܐܠܗܐ܀ ܐܠܗܐ ܐܒܐ ܕܟܠ ܪ̈ܚܡܐ ܘܚܘܣܝܐ: ܡܚ̈ܣܐ ܠܟܬܘܒܐ ܏ܘܫ.

Colophon    This, the first of the Arabic notes on fol. 242 b, offers similar details as the colophon above.   كان الفراغ من نصحة (sic) هذه (sic) المعيد يوم الثلتا (sic) .... سنه الف وخمسه مايه وخمسه وتسعين سنه يونانيه بدير السيده كفتون من اعمال اطرابلس في ايام الاب الفاضل ريس الدير ابا سمعان ابن جاقر اول ريس قام على الدير المقدس, كتبه العبد الخاطي المسكين الفقير من عمل البر الحقير في الكهنه والرهبان جراسمه ابن سمعان من قِريِة الرمانه من عمل الرىداني (sic) من اقليم دمشق وهو يسال لكل من يقرا في هده (sic) الكتاب او ينصخ (sic) منه يترحم عليه وعلَي والديه الله يغفر للكاتب وللقاري وللمعتنى فس هده (sic) الكتاب ولكل من يقول امين امين امين
